gurmukhi: ਕੰਚਨ ਕਲਸ ਜੈਸੇ ਬਾਕੋ ਭੲੇ ਸੂਧੋ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਾਟੀ ਕੋ ਕਲਸੁ ਫੂਟੋ ਜੁਰੈ ਨ ਜਤਨ ਸੈ
transliteration: Kanchan Kalas Jaisay Baako Bhaay Soodho Hoi , Maatee Ko Kalasu Dhooto Jurai N Jatan Sai ?
translation: Just as a golden pitcher if dented can be set right whereas an earthenware pitcher can never be restored to its original shape when broken.

gurmukhi: ਬਸਨ ਮਲੀਨ ਧੋੲੇ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਹੋਤ ਜੈਸੇ ੳੂਜਰੀ ਨ ਹੋਤ ਕਾਂਬਰੀ ਪਤਨ ਸੈ
transliteration: Basan Maleen Dhoay Niramal Hot Jaisay , Oojaree N Hot Kaanbaree Patan Sai ?
translation: Just as a dirty cloth can be made clean by washing, whereas a black blanket can never become white till reduced to tatters.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਲਕੁਟੀ ਅਗਨਿ ਸੇਕਤ ਹੀ ਸੂਧੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਸ੍ਵਾਨ ਪੂਛਿ ਪਟੰਤਰੋ ਪ੍ਰਗਟ ਮਨ ਤਨ ਸੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Lakoutee Agani Saykat Hee Soodhee Hoi , Svaan Poochhi Patantaro Pragat Man Tan Sai ?
translation: Just as a wooden stick when heated on fire can be straightened, but a dog's tail can never be straightened despite numerous efforts.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਨ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਜਲ ਮੈ ਨ ਗਤਿ ਸਾਕਤ ਸੁਭਾਵ ਲਾਖ ਪਾਹੁਨ ਗਤਨ ਸੈ ||੩੯੦||
transliteration: Taisay Gursikhan Soubhaau Jal Mai N Gati , Saakat Soubhaav Laakh Paahoun Gatan Sai ?390?
translation: So is the nature of True Guru-oriented obedient Sikhs who are tender and malleable like water and wax. On the other hand, the temperament of mammon-loving person is rigid and hard like shellac and stone and thus is destructive.  (390)
